summary: A letter from the UK Metropolitan Police's Deputy Assistant Commissioner to US Attorney Geoffrey Berman, providing the contact details for Prince Andrew's solicitor in relation to the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It references prior contact by US Embassy representatives in London.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Recipient of the letter, leading the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the US investigation (United States v. Jeffrey Epstein) for allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The individual whose solicitor's contact details are being provided to the US investigation.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.context: Solicitor for Prince Andrew, affiliated with Blackfords LLP. His contact details are provided to the US investigation.

connections.description: Gary Bloxsome is identified as the solicitor for Prince Andrew.
Berman is the US Attorney leading the prosecution against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Metropolitan Police Letter to US Attorney
events.description: The Metropolitan Police in London provides contact details for Prince Andrew's solicitor to US Attorney Geoffrey Berman regarding the Epstein investigation.

locations: New Scotland Yard, 1-8 Richmond Terrace, Victoria Embankment, London SW1A
Blackfords LLP, 15 Old Bailey, London EC4M 7EF
keyFacts: The UK Metropolitan Police was formally assisting the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein by providing contact information for Prince Andrew's legal representative.
US Embassy representatives in London had previously contacted the Metropolitan Police on behalf of the US investigation to request Prince Andrew's solicitor's details.
The document directly links the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein with efforts to contact Prince Andrew through his solicitor, Gary Bloxsome of Blackfords LLP.
The correspondence is dated December 2019, after Epstein's death, indicating the investigation into his associates was ongoing.
